intro: Stauracanthus nepa f. escayracii, commonly known as the Escayracii stauracanthus, is a rare and lesser-known plant species belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive leaf morphology, featuring a broad, ovate shape with a prominent midrib and a serrated margin. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, which bloom during the late spring to early summer season. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
